document_data.name: Archer
document_data.refs5e: <ref group="note">For the purposes of game mechanics, nonplayer-character archers were treated similarly to a creature in the 5{{th}} edition ''[[Volo's Guide to Monsters]]''.
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/45/Leomund's Tiny Hut: Missile Fire and the Archer Subclass|35}}
document_data.mainbody: In [[Faerûn]] archers could be found across the [[Sword Coast]], as well as in [[west Faerûn]] in the nations of [[Amn]] and [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Activities: An archer was typically worked as artillery in military units, castle defenders, a hunter of wild game, and occasionally worked as brigands or caravan guards.

In [[Faerûn]] archers could be found across the [[Sword Coast]], as well as in [[west Faerûn]] in the nations of [[Amn]] and [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Abilities: Like any ranger, archers had some degree of training in [[magic]].
document_data.Combat: Through archers were primarily bow users — from [[longbow]]s and [[shortbow]]s to [[crossbow]]s — they also typically had some skill with throwing weapons, such as [[sling]]s. Having devoted themselves to archery, they were less skilled than other rangers in the use of melee weaponry, especially blunt weaponry.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1359}}, during the [[Bloodstone Wars]] the "army of the minor baronies" boasted 260 archers.
document_data.Notable Archers:
* The [[Huntress]], a [[demon]]ic [[humanoid]] archer who was linked to the fortress of [[Watcher's Keep]] during the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].
* [[Schael Corwin]], an officer of the [[Flaming Fist]] during the mid–14{{th}} century DR.
